law.catch_line: Possession or viewing of matter portraying a sexual performance by a minor -- Applicability.

text.section:
A person is guilty of possession or viewing of matter portraying a sexual performance by a minor when, having knowledge of its content, character, and that the sexual performance is by a minor, he or she:
Knowingly has in his or her possession or control any matter which visually depicts an actual sexual performance by a minor person; or
Intentionally views any matter which visually depicts an actual sexual performance by a minor person.

The provisions of subsection (1)(b) of this section:
Shall only apply to the deliberate, purposeful, and voluntary viewing of matter depicting sexual conduct by a minor person and not to the accidental or inadvertent viewing of such matter;
Shall not apply to persons viewing the matter in the course of a law enforcement investigation or criminal or civil litigation involving the matter; and
Shall not apply to viewing the matter by a minor or the minor's parents or guardians, or to school administrators investigating violations of subsection (1)(b) of this section.
Possession or viewing of matter portraying a sexual performance by a minor is a Class D felony.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 41, sec. 5, effective June 25, 2013. -- Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 182, sec. 39, effective July 12, 2006. -- Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 201, sec. 1, effective July 14, 1992.
